702526f-a.text:
West 12th Street, east side, at and north of Surf Ave., showing "Over the Falls". Note the B.M.T. train in background, at its Coney Island
terminal.
August 8, 1932.
P. L. Sperr.

706963f-a.folder: Surf Ave. & 12th St. W., Brooklyn, NY
706963f-a.text:
(1)
Surf Ave., north side, west of West 12th Street, showing the Boston Hotel in the foreground, and Loew's theatre (8-story structure in the background).
October 1928.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
(2)
The same, showing Loew's Theatre under construction.
November 1924.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
(3)
The same, showing the theatre building completed.
June 1925.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

Surf Ave., south side, at West 12th Street, showing partially, at the right, Child's Restaurant, and on the opposite corner the Brooklyn Trust Co. Coney Island Branch building.
January 1924.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

was demolished in March 1929.

706969f-a.folder: Surf Ave. & 12th St. W., Brooklyn, NY
706969f-a.text:
(1)
Surf Ave., North side, east of West 19th Street, showing Luna Park, which extends to East 10th Street. This park was established, May 16, 1903, by Thompson and Dundy on 22 acres of ground, which increased to 38 acres in 1904. Frederick Thompson conducted same, alone, at a later
date. Ia 1924, Barron Collier was the owner.
September 1926.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
(2)
Another view in the opposite direction.
January 1924.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
(3)
A view of the entrance.
January 1924.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
(4)
An interior view of the park, undoubtedly quite early.
About 1905.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

706970f-a.folder: Surf Ave. & 12th St. W., Brooklyn, NY
706970f-a.text:
(1) Surf Ave., north side, east from West 12th Street, showing at the left, the entrance to Luna Park.

August 1924.

Eugene L. Armbruster Collection

(2) The same, another angle.

June 1925.

Eugene L. Armbruster Collection

(3) A view further eastward and showing Thompson Scenic Railway, an attraction of the park, that was operated as a separate unit.

January 1924.

Eugene L. Armbruster Collection

(4) The same as No. 3.

April 2, 1924.

Eugene L. Armbruster Collection
